entry.title: The Little-Known ‘Supreme Court Justices’ Who Decide Your Electricity Rates
entry.summary: A few people in each state oversee where and how we get electricity. They’re called public utility commissioners.

entry.title: Medicine Is Under-Politicised in the UK
entry.summary: A further discussion of how societal problems that impact medicine and health policy are largely kept out of political discourse.

entry.title: RDP without the risk: Cloudflare's browser-based solution for secure third-party access
entry.summary: Cloudflare now provides clientless, browser-based support for the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP). It enables secure, remote Windows server access without VPNs or RDP clients.

entry.title: Detecting sensitive data and misconfigurations in AWS and GCP with Cloudflare One
entry.summary: Using Cloudflare’s CASB, integrate, scan, and detect sensitive data and misconfigurations in your cloud storage accounts.

entry.title: Enhance data protection in Microsoft Outlook with Cloudflare One’s new DLP Assist
entry.summary: Customers can now easily safeguard sensitive data in Microsoft Outlook with our new DLP Assist feature.

entry.title: Prepping for post-quantum: a beginner’s guide to lattice cryptography
entry.summary: This post is a beginner's guide to lattices, the math at the heart of the transition to post-quantum (PQ) cryptography. It explains how to do lattice-based encryption and authentication from scratch.

entry.title: Improving Data Loss Prevention accuracy with AI-powered context analysis
entry.summary: Cloudflare’s Data Loss Prevention is reducing false positives by using a self-improving AI-powered algorithm, built on Cloudflare’s Developer Platform.

entry.title: Cloudflare is now IRAP assessed at the PROTECTED level, furthering our commitment to the global public sector
entry.summary: Cloudflare is now assessed at the IRAP PROTECTED level, bringing our products and services to the Australian Public Sector.

entry.title: Moody’s Heaps Further Pressure on Mexico’s Economy by Changing Outlook of Banking System to Negative
entry.summary: This time, it's not just Wall Street banks that should be worried about the contagion risks of a full-blown banking crisis in Mexico. So, too, should their European counterparts.

entry.title: Dark energy might be weakening + 1 more story
entry.summary: Scientists create largest 3D universe map, suggesting dark energy may weaken; Research shows modern humans evolved from two ancient populations.

entry.title: Cloudflare named a leader in Web Application Firewall Solutions in 2025 Forrester report
entry.summary: Forrester Research has recognized Cloudflare as a Leader in its The Forrester Wave™: Web Application Firewall Solutions, Q1 2025 report.

entry.title: Master architecture decision records (ADRs): Best practices for effective decision-making
entry.summary: In this post, you'll learn how to implement Architecture Decision Records (ADRs) in your organization, based on best practices developed from experience with over 200 ADRs across multiple projects. You'll also discover practical tips for streamlining architectural decision-making, see real-world examples from projects with teams ranging from 10 to over 100 members, and understand the common challenges in architecture decision-making and how ADRs can help address them.

entry.title: Pilot light with reserved capacity: How to optimize DR cost using On-Demand Capacity Reservations
entry.summary: In this post, we explore an intermediate strategy between the pilot light and the warm standby strategies: pilot light with reserved capacity. You can use this strategy to reserve compute capacity in a secondary Region while also limiting cost.

entry.title: Introducing Cloudy, Cloudflare’s AI agent for simplifying complex configurations
entry.summary: Cloudflare’s first AI agent, Cloudy, helps make complicated configurations easy to understand for Cloudflare administrators.

entry.title: HTTPS-only for Cloudflare APIs: shutting the door on cleartext traffic
entry.summary: We are closing the cleartext HTTP ports entirely for Cloudflare API traffic. This prevents the risk of clients unintentionally leaking their secret API keys in cleartext during the initial request.

entry.title: Simplify allowlist management and lock down origin access with Cloudflare Aegis
entry.summary: Cloudflare Aegis provides dedicated egress IPs for Zero Trust origin access strategies, now supporting BYOIP and customer-facing configurability, with observability of Aegis IP utilization soon.

entry.title: Making Application Security simple with a new unified dashboard experience
entry.summary: We’re introducing a new Application Security experience in the Cloudflare dashboard, with a reworked UI organized by use cases, making it easier for customers to navigate and secure their accounts.

entry.summary: Escalation in the DRC.

Introduction Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS) Hybrid Nodes transform how you run generative AI inference workloads across cloud and on-premises environments. Extending your EKS cluster to on-premises infrastructure allows you […]

entry.title: IssueOps: Automate CI/CD (and more!) with GitHub Issues and Actions
entry.summary:
A look into building IssueOps workflows on GitHub to do everything from CI/CD to handling approvals and more.

The post IssueOps: Automate CI/CD (and more!) with GitHub Issues and Actions appeared first on The GitHub Blog.

author.name: The latest from GitHub's engineering team - The GitHub Blog

entry.title: Cloudflare for AI: supporting AI adoption at scale with a security-first approach
entry.summary: With Cloudflare for AI, developers, security teams and content creators can leverage Cloudflare’s network and portfolio of tools to secure, observe and make AI applications resilient and safe to use.

entry.title: Improved Bot Management flexibility and visibility with new high-precision heuristics
entry.summary: By building and integrating a new heuristics framework into the Cloudflare Ruleset Engine, we now have a more flexible system to write rules and deploy new releases rapidly.

entry.title: Take control of public AI application security with Cloudflare's Firewall for AI
entry.summary: Firewall for AI discovers and protects your public LLM-powered applications, and is seamlessly integrated with Cloudflare WAF. Join the beta now and take control of your generative AI security.

entry.title: Trapping misbehaving bots in an AI Labyrinth
entry.summary: How Cloudflare uses generative AI to slow down, confuse, and waste the resources of AI Crawlers and other bots that don’t respect “no crawl” directives.

entry.title: An early look at cryptographic watermarks for AI-generated content
entry.summary: It's hard to tell the difference between web content produced by humans and web content produced by AI. We're taking new approach to making AI content distinguishable without impacting performance.

entry.title: How we train AI to uncover malicious JavaScript intent and make web surfing safer
entry.summary: Learn more about how Cloudflare developed an AI model to uncover malicious JavaScript intent using a Graph Neural Network, from pre-processing data to inferencing at scale.

entry.title: Unleashing improved context for threat actor activity with our Cloudforce One threat events platform
entry.summary: Gain real-time insights with our new threat events platform. This tool empowers your cybersecurity defense with actionable intelligence to stay ahead of attacks and protect your critical assets.

entry.title: Extending Cloudflare Radar’s security insights with new DDoS, leaked credentials, and bots datasets
entry.summary: For Security Week 2025, we are adding several new DDoS-focused graphs, new insights into leaked credential trends, and a new Bots page to Cloudflare Radar.
